summary: The TUTOR Act of 2025 (H.R. 4010) prohibits the Department of Defense from contracting with certain foreign-owned online tutoring services. It amends Section 854 of the Servicemember Quality of Life Improvement and National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2025. The bill defines "country of concern" as China, Russia, Iran, and North Korea, effectively barring contracts with tutoring services originating from those nations.
